agency_desc: Provides law enforcement services and maintains the correctional facility for Randolph County.
service_description: Provides law enforcement, crime prevention, and criminal investigation services and administers county correctional facilities in Randolph County. Operates a 24-hour dispatch service for police officers, firefighters, and medics (ambulances) in Randolph County. A ten-digit dispatch number is provided for nonemergency dispatch calls. For emergency assistance, persons should call 9-1-1.
site_details: Call 9-1-1 for emergency police, fire, or medical assistance. For nonemergency requests or reports, call the office during normal business hours. nonemergency dispatch number.
site_eligibility: Open; serves Randolph County
To visit: Must be on the inmate's approved visitor list -- Age 18 or older (or accompanied by someone over 18 who is also on the inmate's  approved visitor list)

agency_name: VOLUNTEERS OF AMERICA OF OHIO AND INDIANA
agency_desc: A faith-based, nonprofit organization offering counseling, rehabilitation, job placement, and residential services.
service_description: Provides residential substance use treatment and support services for pregnant women recovering from substance use disorder including opioid use disorder. The women (and up to two pre-school aged children) may stay during their pregnancy and after the birth for a maximum of 75 days. Clients receive a clinical assessment, treatment, pre- and post-natal support, and parenting and life-skills training. Medical detoxification is not provided. Ongoing home-based services are provided up to one year after discharge. Programming may differ for women who have an open case with the Indiana Department of Child Services (DCS).
taxonomy_name: Inpatient Substance Use Disorder Treatment Facilities
Medication Assisted Maintenance Treatment for Substance Use Disorders
Transitional Residential Substance Use Disorder Services
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
nameLevel3: Transitional Residential Substance Use Disorder Services
nameLevel4: Inpatient Substance Use Disorder Treatment Facilities
Medication Assisted Maintenance Treatment for Substance Use Disorders
site_details: Call the office for availability and complete a phone assessment; if voicemail is reached, leave contact information, or try calling again later to reach a staff person. -OR- Submit an assessment online.

site_schedule.name: Inpatient Substance Use Disorder Treatment Facilities
site_schedule.schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 8am-5pm -- Recovery Center: Daily 24 hours

site_schedule.name: Medication Assisted Maintenance Treatment for Substance Use Disorders
site_schedule.schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 8am-5pm -- Recovery Center: Daily 24 hours

site_schedule.name: Transitional Residential Substance Use Disorder Services
site_schedule.schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 8am-5pm -- Recovery Center: Daily 24 hours

site_eligibility: Pregnant women with or without children -OR- women with two or less children, age 5 or younger -- Age 18 or older -- Struggling with a substance addiction, including opioid use -- Eligible for Medicaid or Active DCS Case

agency_desc: "OVGC is an investor-owned utility which provides natural gas distribution and transportation services to residential, commercial, industrial, and governmental customers in 16 Indiana counties and 1 county in Ohio."
site_name: OHIO VALLEY GAS CORPORATION - CORPORATE OFFICE
service_description: Responsible for handling natural gas service billing and collection problems, and for responding to inquiries about fees, charges and payment options.
site_details: Call or visit the website for information.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: "OVGC is an investor-owned utility which provides natural gas distribution and transportation services to residential, commercial, industrial, and governmental customers in 16 Indiana counties and 1 county in Ohio."
site_name: OHIO VALLEY GAS CORPORATION - WINCHESTER / UNION CITY DISTRICT
service_description: Provides natural gas utility services and handles billing and connections/disconnections for customers in select areas of Randolph and Wayne County. Special payment plans, including a budget payment plan to spread the cost of service out more equally throughout the year, may be available for customers.
site_details: Walk in, call, or visit the website for information.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A church with worship services and charitable outreach, including a food pantry.
service_description: Provides perishable and nonperishable food to persons in need. Limited service area.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Randolph County or Parker City residents  -- Not received food from this pantry within the past month

agency_name: WINCHESTER AREA CHURCHES AND COMMUNITY FOOD PANTRY
agency_desc: A faith-based, nonprofit food pantry.
site_name: WINCHESTER AREA CHURCHES AND COMMUNITY FOOD PANTRY
service_description: Provides perishable and nonperishable food to people in need. Limited service area. DURING COVID-19 ONLY ONE PERSON AT A TIME ALLOWED INSIDE
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Living in Randolph County -- With household income at or below 185% of the Federal Poverty Level -- Not received food from this pantry in the last month

agency_desc: A church with charitable outreach including a food pantry, clothing pantry, and community meal.
service_description: Offers donated clothing to persons in need each month.
site_details: Walk in. Pantry door at the back of the church.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as: Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.

service_description: Provides food to people in need. Limited service area.
site_details: Call ahead to confirm hours.
site_eligibility: Living in Jackson or Wayne Township of Randolph County, Indiana   (or in Jackson, Washington Township of Darke County, Ohio) -- Not used this pantry within the past 2 months -- With all required documentation

Living in Jackson or Wayne Township of Randolph County, Indiana or in Jackson, Washington Township of Darke County, Ohio -- With disconnect notice for utilities, eviction notice (or proof of 30 days past due) for rent -- Not received financial assistance from this agency within the past year -- With all required documentation
Open

agency_desc: Represents the state of Indiana in felony and misdemeanor criminal prosecutions, conducts criminal investigations, supervises Grand Jury proceedings, enforces child support orders, conducts juvenile adjudication and prosecution, enforces traffic violations, and provides information and assistance to victims of crime.
service_description: Represents the state of Indiana in all felony and misdemeanor criminal prosecutions resulting from crimes committed in Randolph County. The prosecutor's office also conducts criminal investigations, supervises Grand Jury proceedings, enforces child support orders, conducts juvenile adjudication and prosecution, enforces traffic laws, and provides information and assistance to victims of crime.
site_details: Call or walk in for more information.
site_eligibility: Varies by service

To File for Child Support Assistance:   Living in Randolph County -- Parent, guardian, aunt, uncle, or grandparent who has physical custody of a child (ages 0-18) -- Requiring financial support from a noncustodial parent of the child
Victims of major crimes in Randolph County with a case that has been filed with the court.

agency_desc: A faith-based, nonprofit organization providing charitable outreach programs to people in need.
service_description: Provides emergency rent or utility assistance to eligible persons in need. Prescription expense assistance may also be available. Assistance is not available for deposits or reconnect fees.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Living in Randolph County (except for Jackson and Wayne Township) -- Not received assistance from the Salvation Army in the past 3 months

agency_desc: Serves as the executive and administrative authority for Randolph County.
service_description: Serves as the executive and administrative authority for Randolph County, including performing the following duties: Controls, maintains, and supervises county property -- Audits and authorizes claims against the county -- Receives bids for and authorizes county contracts -- Performs certain election functions -- Handles appeals of township trustee decisions
site_details: Call or visit the website for more information.

site_schedule.name: General Relief Appeals/Complaints
site_schedule.schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- Board Meetings: Monthly 1st and 3rd Mon 9am

site_schedule.name: Local Officials Offices
site_schedule.schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- Board Meetings: Monthly 1st and 3rd Mon 9am

site_eligibility: Varies by service

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Offers limited adult vaccinations, including tetanus (TDAP), hepatitis A, and hepatitis B.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment or for availability of walk-in hours.

site_schedule.schedule: Mon, Tues, Wed, and Fri 8am-4pm; by appointment only

site_eligibility: Age 19 or older
Varies by service; serves Randolph County
Living in Randolph County

Living in Randolph County -- Testing is recommended for any child six months through six years old who: Lives in or visits a building constructed before 1978 -OR- lives with someone who works with lead (such as a battery factory, steel smelter, stained glass) -OR- has a sibling or playmate who has been diagnosed with lead poisoning.
Schools, community organizations, and other groups in Randolph County
Age 6 months or older

Living in Randolph County -- Age 2 months-18 years -- Without health insurance -OR- insurance does not cover needed vaccine (including coverage that has capped out) -OR- insured through Medicaid -OR- American Indian or Alaskan Native, regardless of insurance status
Births/deaths occurring in Randolph County -- Individual named on the birth certificate, parent, or other adult with a legal right to the certificate
Varies by service; call for information.

agency_desc: The County Clerk maintains records of all civil and criminal court activities; administers jury draw, child support collections, and voter registration; issues marriage licenses; and records state tax liens in Randolph County.

site_eligibility: Registering to vote: United States citizen -- Age 18 by the day of the next election -- Not currently incarcerated -- To vote: Registered to vote a minimum of 29 days before the election

Parents ordered by the court to pay or receive child support

Marriage license: Both parties at least age 18 (call or visit website for exceptions) -- At least one applicant from this county -OR- both from out of state -- Certified copies: License must have been issued in this county

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency that administers housing assistance programs.
service_description: Serves as an application and re-certification site for the Section 8 Housing Choice Voucher program in Union City. Housing Choice Vouchers help eligible households pay the rent on privately owned homes of their choosing (property owners must agree to program participation). The wait list for Housing Choice Vouchers in this area is always OPEN. People already on the wait list must keep their contact information current to remain on the list.
site_details: Walk in, or send proxy, to pick up an application for the wait list; home-bound clients may call to have an application mailed. Once application is turned, applicant will be put on wait list. -- Those already on the wait list should call to update contact information as needed. -- Once name reaches top of wait list, office will call to schedule an appointment and issue voucher that day. Applicant will have 60 days to find a place to live.
site_eligibility: Household income below set limits -- Preference given to people with disabilities and those with an income.

agency_desc: Government agency that locates, identifies, and appraises all taxable property in Randolph County.
service_description: Calculates the value of all taxable property in Randolph County, which is then used to assess taxes.  Hears appeals of assessments, oversees reassessments, and maintains information on boundaries and ownership.
site_details: Call or visit the website for more information.
site_eligibility: Varies by service; limited to taxable property in Randolph County

agency_desc: Provides law enforcement, crime investigation, crime prevention, emergency assistance, and other police duties.
service_description: Provides law enforcement, crime investigation, crime prevention, emergency assistance, and other police duties for the city of Union City in Randolph County. Persons in need of emergency police assistance should call 9-1-1.
site_details: Call 9-1-1 for emergency assistance. For nonemergency services, call the office during business hours or call Randolph County dispatch after hours.
site_eligibility: Open; serves the city of Union City

agency_desc: Provides law enforcement, crime investigation, crime prevention, emergency assistance, and other police duties for the city of Winchester in Randolph County.
service_description: Provides law enforcement, crime investigation, crime prevention, emergency assistance, and other police duties. Persons in need of emergency police assistance should call 9-1-1.
site_details: Call 9-1-1 for emergency assistance. -- For non-emergency services, call the office during business hours.
site_eligibility: Open; serves city of Winchester

agency_desc: Provides law enforcement, crime investigation, crime prevention, emergency assistance, and other police duties for the city of Winchester in Randolph County.
site_name: WINCHESTER ANIMAL CONTROL AND RESCUE SHELTER
service_description: Enforces animal-related ordinances, responds to animal-related emergencies, impounds stray domestic animals, and accepts surrendered animals from the public. Provides lost-and-found services, microchipping of pets, and adoption for homeless dogs and cats. Issues pet licenses.
site_details: Call for assistance.
site_eligibility: Living in city of Winchester

agency_desc: Provides emergency fire and medical services for the city of Winchester in Randolph County.
service_description: Responds to fire, emergency medical, hazardous material, and special rescue situations in the city of Winchester in Randolph County. Nonemergency services include fire prevention education and public awareness. Persons in need of emergency services should call 9-1-1.
site_details: Call 9-1-1 for emergency assistance. For nonemergency services, call the office during business hours.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: Serves as the state trial court for the county, hearing both civil and criminal cases.
service_description: Oversees both criminal and civil trials, including juvenile and family cases, in Randolph County.
site_details: Varies; cases are generally initiated through the prosecutor's office, private attorneys -- individuals representing themselves. For juror information, contact the assigned court.
site_eligibility: Persons named in cases or called for jury duty at this court

agency_desc: Serves as the state trial court for the county, hearing both civil and criminal cases.
service_description: Handles civil lawsuits for $6,000 or less, including contracts, collection of rent, evictions, and personal loans. Only corporations are required to be represented by an attorney and only on claims over $1,500. In Randolph County, the Superior Court handles small claims cases.
site_details: Walk in to County Clerk's office for claim forms.
site_eligibility: To file a lawsuit: Age 18 or older -- With a civil claim for less than $6,000 -- Meeting one of the following three requirements: Person being sued lives or works in Randolph County -- Matter resulting in lawsuit took place in Randolph County -- Matter resulting in lawsuit was to be performed in Randolph County

agency_desc: Serves as the state trial court for the county, hearing both civil and criminal cases.
service_description: Provides probation services for the Randolph County Circuit and Superior Courts, including supervising juvenile and adult offenders in the community and linking them with programs and services to support their rehabilitation.
site_details: Through the courts; call for details.
site_eligibility: Offenders assigned to probation by the Randolph County Courts

agency_desc: Provides governance and municipal services for the city of Winchester in Randolph County.
service_description: Provides wastewater utility services for the city of Winchester in Randolph County.
site_details: Visit the website or call for assistance. -- Bills may be paid online, in person, by mail, or by phone.
site_eligibility: Open; serves the city of Winchester

agency_desc: Provides governance and municipal services for the city of Winchester in Randolph County.
service_description: Provides trash collection services, street and sidewalk maintenance, snow and ice control, street-sign maintenance, mosquito control, groundskeeping of public properties, and seasonal leaf/brush collection in the city of Winchester in Randolph County. Coordinates with Bestway Service and the Randolph County Solid Waste District to provide recycling programs for the community.
site_details: Call for information, to submit a request, or make a report.

site_schedule.name: City/County Parks
site_schedule.schedule: Mon-Fri 7am-4pm -- Parks: Daily dawn to dusk, unless otherwise noted

site_eligibility: Open; serves the city of Winchester
Parks are open to all; some programs may have specific requirements

agency_desc: Provides maintenance services on public roads and streets.
service_description: Maintains county roadways in Randolph County, including patching, paving, snow removal, street sweeping, roadside mowing, and drainage along roadways. Offers sandbags to Randolph County households during times of flooding.
site_details: Call for information or to report a problem. To report urgent problems after hours, call 9-1-1 or Randolph County dispatch. -- For sandbags during times of flooding, be prepared to fill and haul sandbags.
site_eligibility: Open (limited to county roads and county properties in Randolph County)

agency_desc: The District's mission is "to proactively reduce the amount of waste going to landfills and incinerators through education, source reduction, reuse and recycling."
service_description: Provides information about and referrals to recycling sites and programs in Randolph County. Offers public awareness, classroom activities, and other educational resources.
site_details: Call or visit website for information or referrals.
site_eligibility: Recycling Issues -- Open

agency_desc: The District's mission is "to proactively reduce the amount of waste going to landfills and incinerators through education, source reduction, reuse and recycling."
service_description: Offers a waste disposal site March through October. Materials accepted include prescription drugs/medications, household hazardous wastes, fluorescent light bulbs, electronics, appliances, and tires. Fees may apply for some items.
site_details: Walk in during event hours.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A cooperative of school districts that provides centralized special education services to students living within the boundaries of the participating school districts.
service_description: Provides education support for students with disabilities and special needs. Services range from consultation to resource rooms to self-contained classrooms, depending on the individual needs of the student. Assessment and special education services are generally accessed through the assigned public school.
site_details: Call for information about special education services.

site_schedule.name: Special Education
site_schedule.schedule: Traditional School Year: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- Summer: Mon-Fri 7am-3pm

site_schedule.name: Student Disability Services
site_schedule.schedule: Traditional School Year: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- Summer: Mon-Fri 7am-3pm

site_eligibility: Living in one of the following Randolph County school districts: Liberty-Perry Community, Monroe Central, Randolph Central, Randolph Eastern, or Randolph Southern -- Age 3-22 years-old -- With special needs, including developmental, vision, and hearing impairments

agency_desc: A public library that provides access to fiction and non-fiction library materials to patrons of all ages.
service_description: Maintains a public lending library and provides phone-based reference assistance. In-house services include public computer and Internet access.
site_details: Walk in to apply for a library card, check out materials, or use in-house services. Call for information.

site_schedule.name: Public Internet Access Sites
site_schedule.schedule: Mon and Sat 10am-2pm; Tues and Thurs 1pm-7pm

site_schedule.name: Public Wi-Fi Sites
site_schedule.schedule: Mon and Sat 10am-2pm; Tues and Thurs 1pm-7pm

site_schedule.name: Public Libraries
site_schedule.schedule: Mon and Sat 10am-2pm; Tues and Thurs 1pm-7pm

site_eligibility: Most in-house services, including computer stations: Open -- For a library card: Living in Monroe, Stoney Creek, or Union Township -OR- Living in the town of Farmland in Randolph County

agency_desc: A public library that provides access to fiction and non-fiction library materials to patrons of all ages.
service_description: Maintains a public lending library and provides phone-based reference assistance. In-house services include public computer and Internet access.
site_details: Walk in to apply for a library card, check out materials, or use in-house services. Call for information.
site_eligibility: Most in-house services, including computer stations: Open -- For a library card: Living in Union City, Wayne Township or Jackson Township of Randolph County

agency_desc: A public library that provides access to fiction and non-fiction library materials to patrons of all ages.
service_description: Maintains a public lending library and provides phone-based reference assistance. In-house services include public computer and Internet access.
site_details: Walk in to apply for a library card, check out materials, or use in-house services. Call for information.
site_eligibility: Residents of Washington, Union, and Greensfolk Township

agency_desc: A public library that provides access to fiction and non-fiction library materials to patrons of all ages.
service_description: Maintains a public lending library and provides phone-based reference assistance. In-house services include public computer and Internet access.
site_details: Walk in to apply for a library card, check out materials, or use in-house services. Call for information.
site_eligibility: Most in-house services, including computer stations: Open; youth under age 18 must have signed    permission from parent or guardian -- For a library card: Living within Ward or White River Township of Randolph County
Living in Ward or White River Township in Randolph County -- Homebound due to chronic or extended illness or physical disability

agency_desc: County veterans service officers are veterans employed by the county to act as liaisons with county residents for veteran issues, including but not limited to; providing forms, information, and assistance in obtaining state and federal veterans benefits.
service_description: Provides information about and assistance with veterans' benefits to veterans, their surviving spouses, and their children. County service officers can assist in the completion and submission of forms necessary to receive all appropriate federal and state veterans' benefits.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Veteran -- surviving spouses or children of a veteran

agency_desc: Provides pregnancy counseling and support from a pro-life perspective and offers referrals to prenatal care, adoption resources, and other abortion alternatives.
service_description: Provides pregnancy counseling and support from a pro-life perspective and offers referrals to prenatal care, adoption resources, and other abortion alternatives. Also offers free pregnancy testing and pregnancy verification.
site_details: Walk in or call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Pregnant women in need of services
Living in Randolph County and surrounding areas -- Mothers of young children
Expecting parents -OR- Parents of children age 4 or younger

agency_desc: A nonprofit health network with a Catholic perspective offering hospitals, physicians, and specialty services throughout central and southern Indiana.
service_name: RURAL AND URBAN ACCESS TO HEALTH
service_description: Provides one-on-one assistance to help people in rural and under-served areas apply for health and human service benefits, find affordable health care, access prescription assistance programs, and connect with community resources. Care coordination, follow-up services, diabetes management training and information, and smoking cessation tools and programs are also available. Health access workers can meet with clients at their homes or convenient community locations.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment. Messages will be returned within 1-2 business days.
site_eligibility: Open
Victims of sexual assault and/or domestic violence -- In need of abuse exams and bodily evidence collection

agency_desc: A nonprofit health network with a Catholic perspective offering hospitals, physicians, and specialty services throughout central and southern Indiana.
site_name: ASCENSION ST. VINCENT WINCHESTER PRIMARY CARE
service_description: Provides primary care for all ages, including physical exams, school/sports physicals, sick care, and gynecological services. Services are provided by physicians and nurse practitioners. Sliding-scale payment options are available for low-income patients who are uninsured or underinsured.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.

site_schedule.name: Community Clinics
site_schedule.schedule: Mon, Tues, and Thurs 7:30am-6pm; Wed 7:30am-5:30pm; Fri 7:30am-5pm

site_schedule.name: Obstetrics/Gynecology
site_schedule.schedule: Mon, Tues, and Thurs 7:30am-6pm; Wed 7:30am-5:30pm; Fri 7:30am-5pm

site_eligibility: Open for services; under 400% Federal Poverty Level for financial assistance

agency_desc: A nonprofit health network with a Catholic perspective offering hospitals, physicians, and specialty services throughout central and southern Indiana.
site_name: ASCENSION ST. VINCENT UNION CITY PRIMARY CARE
service_description: Provides primary care for all ages, including physical exams, school/sports physicals, sick care, obstetrics, and gynecological services. Services are provided by physicians and nurse practitioners. Sliding-scale payment options are available for low-income patients who are uninsured or underinsured.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Open for services; under 400% Federal Poverty Level for financial assistance

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization providing housing options, harm reduction services, and outreach to veterans experiencing homelessness.
service_description: Provides 10-bed transitional housing and support services for male homeless veterans, with a goal of permanent housing and independence. The 3-6 month program targets independent housing, employment opportunities, community involvement, hard reduction case management, and connection to veteran and non-veteran benefits.
site_details: Call for information, check availability, or to schedule an intake assessment.
site_eligibility: Men -- Honorably discharged veteran

agency_desc: A community mental health agency offering consultation and treatment. Outpatient, case management, therapy, residential, vocational, medical, group, and day programs are available.
service_description: Offers outpatient mental health and addiction services for persons of all ages. Programs include general counseling for individuals and families, anger management, psychiatric disorder treatment, substance abuse assessment and counseling, and intensive outpatient programs (IOP). A 24-hour intake and crisis intervention line is available. Persons in crisis may also receive walk-in services during normal business hours.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call Access Line for intake assessment or to make an appointment. -- For crisis intervention, walk in during normal business hours or call the Crisis Line at any time.

site_schedule.name: Outpatient Mental Health Facilities
site_schedule.schedule: Access Line (Scheduling) and Crisis Line: Daily 24 hours -- Local Office: Mon-Fri 8am-5pm

site_schedule.name: General Counseling Services
site_schedule.schedule: Access Line (Scheduling) and Crisis Line: Daily 24 hours -- Local Office: Mon-Fri 8am-5pm

site_schedule.name: Adolescent/Youth Counseling
site_schedule.schedule: Access Line (Scheduling) and Crisis Line: Daily 24 hours -- Local Office: Mon-Fri 8am-5pm

site_schedule.name: Psychiatric Disorder Counseling
site_schedule.schedule: Access Line (Scheduling) and Crisis Line: Daily 24 hours -- Local Office: Mon-Fri 8am-5pm

site_schedule.name: Substance Use Disorder Counseling
site_schedule.schedule: Access Line (Scheduling) and Crisis Line: Daily 24 hours -- Local Office: Mon-Fri 8am-5pm

site_eligibility: In need of mental health or addiction services (based on assessment)

agency_desc: A faith-based organization with a mission "to provide compassionate Rescue services on an immediate and/or long-term basis to the poor and needy of Muncie and East Central Indiana."
site_name: MUNCIE MISSION MINISTRIES- ATTIC WINDOW - WINCHESTER
service_description: Offers new and gently used clothing, furniture, appliances, and miscellaneous household items at discounted prices. Proceeds benefit Muncie Mission Ministries food, shelter, recovery, vocational, and family services programs.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A nonprofit healthcare organization that provides a range of physical and mental health services.
service_description: Offers individual, group, couple, and family counseling; mental health evaluations; psychiatric disorder treatment; and substance abuse assessment and treatment for adults, adolescents, and children. Sliding-scale fees and other forms of financial assistance are available for income-eligible clients.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call to schedule an assessment.
site_eligibility: Open (minimum age served determined by individual assessment)
